result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob K. Potter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge, provide a sample for testing through the Dept. of Corrections as required in felony convictions.

Defendant shall attend counseling/programing as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request. Additionally, defendant is to provide access to all current medical/treatment records.

The defendant shall submit to random urine /PBT testing as required by the agent or any law enforcement personnel .

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  

Defendant shall not possess or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.

timeConds.notes: Defendant granted huber priveleges and is to report on or before 8-10-2014 at 6pm

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob K. Potter

records.addlTxt: Prosecutor, Richard R Lewis, and Defendant, Jacob K. Potter, appeared with Attorney Christine Kuczynski.  Preliminary hearing waived. PSI Ordered  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 10, 2014 at 03:40 pm.

Pre-trial conference on April 8, 2014 at 11:15 am.
Status conference on May 1, 2014 at 01:50 pm.

Prosecutor, Richard R. Lewis, and Defendant, Jacob K. Potter, appeared with Attorney Christine Kuczynski.  The defense waived reading of the complaint and stood mute to the charges.  Based on the defendant standing mute, the Court entered a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 8, 2014 at 11:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 01:50 pm.
